title: Instant Pot Pro Plus
summary: A multi-cooker that pressure cooks, slow cooks, air fries, and more. One device replaces half your kitchen appliances.
editorsNote: Reddit's r/InstantPot has a running joke about the silicone sealing ring permanently absorbing garlic and curry smells ‚Äî buying a second ring for sweet dishes is practically mandatory. Users also note the learning curve for natural vs. quick pressure release confuses beginners and leads to undercooked meals at first.
content:
How to cook real meals on weeknights without spending an hour in the kitchen

It's 6:30 PM on a Tuesday. You just finished work, the fridge has raw chicken and some vegetables, and you're staring at a 45-minute recipe thinking about ordering DoorDash instead. This happens 3-4 times a week for most people ‚Äî the gap between "I should cook" and "I have the time and energy to cook" is where takeout spending ($300-500/month for the average American household) and unhealthy eating habits live. The problem isn't skill or ingredients; it's that traditional cooking methods take too long for modern schedules.

The Instant Pot Pro Plus is a multi-cooker that collapses cooking time by 60-70% using pressure cooking. That 45-minute chicken recipe? Done in 15 minutes. Frozen chicken breasts to shredded chicken for tacos? 25 minutes from frozen, no thawing needed. It also slow cooks, saut√©s, steams, sous vides, air fries, dehydrates, and makes yogurt ‚Äî replacing a pressure cooker, slow cooker, rice cooker, steamer, and air fryer. One device, one pot to clean, instead of five appliances cluttering your kitchen. The app has hundreds of guided recipes that auto-set time and pressure so you don't need to guess.

The standout features for simplifying cooking are the delayed start timer (prep in the morning, set it to cook at 5 PM, dinner's ready when you walk in), the 13 safety mechanisms that make pressure cooking genuinely foolproof (the lid physically cannot open while pressurized), and the dishwasher-safe stainless steel inner pot that makes cleanup a 30-second task. The saut√© function means you can brown onions and meat directly in the pot before pressure cooking ‚Äî no extra pan, no extra cleanup. Pair it with a structured meal-prep routine and the Notion Calendar to block cooking time, and weeknight meals become a solved problem.

The real-world impact is both financial and temporal. Cooking at home with an Instant Pot costs $3-5 per meal versus $15-25 for takeout ‚Äî saving $400-600/month for a family that switches from ordering out 4 times a week. Time saved: 20-30 minutes per meal compared to stovetop cooking, plus the "set it and forget it" nature means you can work, help kids with homework, or relax while dinner cooks itself. The 6-quart model feeds 4-6 people easily, and batch cooking on Sundays (chili, soup, pulled pork) gives you ready-made lunches all week. At $130, it's the single best ROI kitchen purchase you can make.

‚ö° Set it up in 5 minutes

  1. Unbox and do the initial water test ‚Äî add 3 cups of water, seal the lid, and pressure cook for 5 minutes to verify the steam release works
  2. Download the Instant Pot app for hundreds of guided recipes with automatic time/pressure settings
  3. Start with a foolproof recipe: rice (1:1 ratio, 4 minutes) or hard-boiled eggs (5 minutes, ice bath)
  4. Learn the two release methods: Natural Release (let pressure drop on its own ‚Äî for meats) vs. Quick Release (turn the valve ‚Äî for vegetables)
